citation.article-title: Desulfotomaculum alkaliphilum sp. nov., a new alkaliphilic, moderately thermophilic, sulfate-reducing bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Desulfotomaculum alkaliphilum sp. nov.
Desulfotomaculum alkaliphilum (al.ka.li.phi'lum. M. L. fem. n. alkali alkali ; Gr. adj. philos loving; M.L. adj. alkaliphilum alkali-loving)
Cells are vibrioid or curved rods, 0.6-0.7x3.0-3.5 μm, non-motile, which form round endospores.
Strictly anaerobic, chemolithoheterotrophic, alkaliphilic and moderately thermophilic.
The temperature range for growth is 30-60 °C; optimum growth at 50-55 °C.
Obligate alkaliphile that cannot grow at pH 7.0.
The pH range suitable for growth at 50 °C is 8.0-9.15; the optimum pH for growth and sulfidogenesis at 50 °C in sodium carbonate medium is 8.7.
NaCl concentration optimal for growth is 0.1% (w/v) ; the maximum tolerable concentration of NaCl is 5 % (w/v).
Utilizes hydrogen, formate, pyruvate, lactate and ethanol as electron donors and sulfate, sulfite and thiosulfate as electron acceptors.
Requires vitamins or yeast extract for growth.
The G­+C content of DNA is 40.9 mol% (as determined by the thermal denaturation method).
The type strain, S1T, was isolated from a cow}pig manure mixture of a neutral pH.
This strain has been deposited at the DSMZ as DSM 12257T, at the All-Russia Collection of Microorganisms as VKM B-2192T and at the ATCC as ATCC 700784T.
